metadata.title: Blogs about BlueXP platform automation
metadata.purpose: There are several blog articles available to help you better understand the technologies and approaches available for BlueXP automation. Blogs about BlueXP platform automation: hardbreaks, nofooter,icons, font, linkattrs, and imagesdir.

metadata.title: Overview of BlueXP automation options
metadata.purpose: DevOps teams use a variety of tools to automate the setup and administration of their data center environments. NetApp supports many of these technologies for BlueXP and Cloud Volumes ONTAP automation. The tools are commonly based on an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) design.
key_tasks: Terraform
Ansible

metadata.title: Definitions
metadata.purpose: This section describes existing data format definitions. The data definitions are used when making REST API calls.
key_tasks: Definitions

metadata.title: Resources
metadata.purpose: There are many API calls available for each resource. Validates an Azure account request. This operation is deprecated.
key_tasks: Resources

metadata.title: API reference
metadata.purpose: This API reference contains the details of the ONTAP management service REST API calls, including resources, endpoints, parameters, and status codes. You can refer to this content when developing applications that use the REST API.

metadata.title: Typical Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment
metadata.purpose: A summary of the major steps needed to deploy and administer a Cloud Volumes ONTAP instance using the associated REST API is presented below.

metadata.title: Overview
metadata.purpose: ONTAP management service is composed of multiple related REST APIs that enable you to administer your cloud-based and on-premises ONTAP storage resources. Using the REST APIs, you can perform many different operations, including managing Cloud Volumes and high availability resources.
key_tasks: Cloud Volumes ONTAP operations
On-premises ONTAP operations
API workflows
API reference

metadata.title: Prepare to use the API
metadata.purpose: You need to prepare before using the REST APIs provided with the ONTAP management service. You'll need a NetApp account to acquire an access token required to issue the REST API calls.Review REST concepts and implementation.

metadata.title: Security
metadata.purpose: The BlueXP REST APIs provides robust security based on token authentication and authorization. All connections are protected using the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. All NetApp BlueXP services use OAuth 2.0 for authorization.

metadata.title: Add a capacity to an Elastic Volume aggregate
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to add capacity to an existing aggregate with Elastic Volumes enabled. Choose the working environment to use based on the type of deployment: Cloud Volumes or ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Add capacity for single node
Add capacity for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with BYOL licensing (node-based)
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. You can use bring-your-own-license (BYOL) licensing (node-based) A marketplace subscription is not required.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with a capacity-based license
metadata.purpose: You can create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using capacity-based licensing. A marketplace subscription is required. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with PAYGO (node-based)
metadata.purpose: You can create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using a pay-as-you-go (PAYGO) subscription. A NetApp Support Site (NSS) key is recommended to register the system for support.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete a working environment
metadata.purpose: You can delete an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. You can delete a working environment for a single node system.
key_tasks: Delete a working environment for single node
Delete working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get working environments
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the public identifier, working environment identifier, and the storage virtual machine name for Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environments. You can use this workflow to retrieve the working environment details for a single node system. This REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Get working environments for single node
Get working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create an AWS cloud provider account
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create an AWS cloud provider account. Before you begin, you must have AWS credentials.
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the SaaS marketplace account
Step 2. Create the account

metadata.title: Get EBS volume types
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Get EBS volume types for high availability pair, HA pair, Single Node. Use the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Get EBS volume types for single node
Get EBS volume types for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get key pairs
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use the key pairs endpoint to retrieve the AWS key pairs for specific regions.
key_tasks: Get key pairs for single node
Get key pairs for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get packages
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: Get packages for single node, Single Node, High availability pair. You can use this workflow to retrieve the packages information for a single node system.
key_tasks: Get packages for single node
Get packages for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get permutations
metadata.purpose: You can use the permutations endpoint to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP configuration information. You can use this workflow to retrieve configuration information for a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Get permutations for single node
Get permutations for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get regions
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the AWS regions in which an Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment may be created. You can use this workflow to retrieve the regions for a single node system. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Get regions for single node
Get regions for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get route tables
metadata.purpose: You can use the route tables endpoint to retrieve the route table labels for each VPC and their subnet association information. We use the Get route tables workflow only for the high availability pair.
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the region
Step 2. Get the VPC
Step 3. Get the route tables

metadata.title: Get list of virtual private clouds
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve a list of the available virtual private clouds (VPCs) Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment: Cloud Volumes on ONTAP.
key_tasks: Get VPCs for single node
Get VPCs for high availability pair

metadata.title: Add disks to aggregate
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Add disks to an aggregate for a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Add disks to an aggregate for single node
Add disks to an aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create an aggregate
metadata.purpose: You can create a new aggregate within a working environment using this workflow. Choose the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: Single Node, High Volumes. You can issue the REST API call to create an aggregate.
key_tasks: Create aggregate for single node
Create aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a CIFS server configuration
metadata.purpose: If you want to create CIFS volumes on your Cloud Volumes ONTAP system, you first need to configure the CifS server. Review the link:https://.netapp.com/us-en/ontap/smb-config/set-up
key_tasks: Create CIFS server configuration for single node
Create CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create quote
metadata.purpose: You can create a quote for a new volume which returns a resource quote needed to satisfy the request. The resource quote contains aggregate information where the volume will be created and confirms if the space is available.
key_tasks: Create quote for single node
Create quote for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create volume using CIFS
metadata.purpose: If the properties `aggregateName` and `maxNumOfDisksApprovedToAdd` are not provided on the REST API call, the response will fail with a suggested name for the aggregate and the number of disks needed to fulfill the request.Choose the workflow to use
key_tasks: Create volume using CIFS for single node
Create volume using CIFS for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create volume using iSCSI
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. There are two workflows available depending on whether a new or existing iGroup is used.
key_tasks: Create volume using iSCSI for single node
Create volume using iSCSI for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a volume using NFS
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through the NFS protocol. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. If the properties `aggregateName` and `maxNumOfDisksApprovedToAdd` are not
key_tasks: Create a volume using NFS for single node
Create a volume using NFS for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete an aggregate
metadata.purpose: You can delete an existing disk aggregate. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Delete an aggregate for a single node.
key_tasks: Delete aggregate for single node
Delete aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete a CIFS server configuration
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a CIFS server configuration for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Delete CIFS server configuration for single node
Delete CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete volume
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Select the working environment and choose the volume name.
key_tasks: Delete volume for single node
Delete volume for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get aggregates
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use this workflow to retrieve the aggregates for a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Get aggregates for single node
Get aggregates for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get CIFS server configurations
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the CIFS server configurations for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Get CIFS server configuration for single node
Get CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get iGroups
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve all the initiator groups (iGroups) iGroups is a collection of initiators (iSCSI clients) The information is required when creating a volume with the iSCSI protocol.
key_tasks: Get iGroups for single node
Get iGroups for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get volumes
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use this workflow to retrieve a list of volumes for a single node working environment. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Get volumes for single node
Get volumes for high availability pair

metadata.title: Modify a volume
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Modify a volume for a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Modify a volume for single node
Modify volume for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with BYOL licensing
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using bring-your-own-license (BYOL) licensing. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with capacity-based license
metadata.purpose: You can create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using capacity-based licensing. A marketplace subscription is required. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with PAYGO
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new Azure Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using a pay-as-you-go (PAYGO) subscription. A marketplace subscription is required. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete a working environment
metadata.purpose: You can delete an existing Azure Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment. Delete the working environment using the HTTP method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Delete working environment for single node
Delete working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get working environment
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the public identifier, working environment ID, the storage virtual machine name for Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environments. You can use this workflow to retrieve the working environments' details of a single node system.
key_tasks: Get working environment for single node
Get working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create Azure cloud provider account
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create an Azure cloud provider account. An Azure cloud providers account holds access keys required to perform actions in Azure.

metadata.title: Get Azure availability zones
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the Azure availability zones by region. Make sure that you've the Azure subscription ID. You can obtain the ID from the Azure portal.

metadata.title: Get Azure packages
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use this workflow to retrieve the packages information for a single node working environment. The API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Get packages for single node
Get packages for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Azure permutations
metadata.purpose: You can use the permutations endpoint to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP configuration information.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment.
key_tasks: Get permutations for single node
Get permutations for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Azure regions
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the regions in which an Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment may be created. Ensure that you've the Azure subscription ID. You can easily obtain the ID from the Azure portal.
key_tasks: Get Azure regions for single node
Get Azure regions for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Azure storage account types
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can retrieve the supported Azure storage account types for a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Get Azure storage account types for single node
Get Azure storage account types for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Azure VNets
metadata.purpose: You can perform this workflow to retrieve the network extended information. MAke sure that you've the Azure subscription ID. You can easily obtain the ID from the Azure portal.
key_tasks: Get Azure VNets for single node
Get Azure VNets for high availability pair

metadata.title: Add disks to aggregate
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Add disks to an aggregate for a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Add disks to an aggregate for single node
Add disks to an aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create aggregate
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Choose the `publicId` value for the `workingEnvironmentId` in the JSON input. Select the Azure Storage Account Types.
key_tasks: Create aggregate for single node
Create aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create CIFS server configuration
metadata.purpose: You can choose to set up the CIFS server in a workgroup or in an Active Directory domain. Review the link:https://.netapp.com/us-en/ontap/smb-config/set-up-server-workgroup-task.
key_tasks: Create CIFS server configuration for single node
Create CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create quote
metadata.purpose: You can create a quote for a new volume which returns a resource quote. The resource quote contains aggregate information where the volume will be created and confirms if the space is available.
key_tasks: Create quote for single node
Create quote for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a volume using CIFS
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. If a CIFS configuration already exists, perform the workflow link:wf_azure.
key_tasks: Create volume using CIFS for single node
Create volume using CIFS for high availability pair

metadata.purpose: There are two workflows available depending on whether a new or existing iGroup is used. You need to select the correct workflow to create a volume using iSCSI.
key_tasks: Create volume using iSCSI for single node
Create volume using iSCSI for high availability

metadata.title: Create a volume using NFS
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through the NFS protocol.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: hardbreaks, nofooter, linkattrs and imagesdir.
key_tasks: Create a volume using NFS for single node
Create a volume using NFS for high availability pair

Delete aggregate for high availability pair
Delete aggregate for high availability pair

key_tasks: Delete CIFS server configuration for single node
Delete CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete volume
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use this workflow to delete volume for a single node.
key_tasks: Delete volume for single node
Delete volume for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get aggregates
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve a list of available disk aggregates of an Azure working environment. Choose the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: Single Node, High availability pair.

Get aggregates for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get CIFS server configurations
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the CIFS server configurations for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Get CIFS server configuration for single node
Get CIFS server configuration for high availability pair

metadata.purpose: iGroups is a collection of initiators (iSCSI clients) The iGroups information is required when creating a volume with the iSCSI protocol using an existing iGroup.

Get iGroups for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get volumes
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the list of volumes of an Azure working environment.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use this workflow to retrieve volume for a single node.
key_tasks: Get volume for single node
Get volume for high availability pair

metadata.title: Modify a volume

Modify volume for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create aggregate
metadata.purpose: You can create a new aggregate within an Azure working environment using this workflow. Create the working environment by performing the link:wf_azure_cloud_create_we_paygo.
key_tasks: Step 1. Create the working environment
Step 2. Select the Azure Storage Account Types
Step 3. Create the aggregate

metadata.title: Before you begin
metadata.purpose: There are several common workflows you can use with any of the public cloud providers or ONTAP on-premises clusters. The workflows are organized into the following functional categories:Identity and access, SaaS marketplace, and support.
key_tasks: Workflow categories
Connector setup

metadata.title: Create an NSS key
metadata.purpose: You can create an NSS key for a specific NetApp Support Site account. Select the account and choose the `accountId` value for the path parameter. Create the key by issuing a REST API call.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account
Step 2. Create the NSS key

metadata.title: Delete an NSS key
metadata.purpose: You can delete an NetApp Support Site (NSS) key. You can issue a REST API call to delete the NSS keys.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account to use
Step 2. Select the NSS key to delete
Step 3. Delete the NSS keys

metadata.title: Get accounts
metadata.purpose: You can perform this workflow to retrieve accounts. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.

metadata.title: Get an NSS key
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the key for a specific NetApp Support Site account. You can issue the REST API call to retrieve the NSS key. The API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account
Step 2. Select the NSS key to retrieve
Step 3. Retrieve the NSS key

metadata.title: Get NSS keys
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve all of the available NetApp Support Site credential keys. Select the account to use and choose the `accountId` value for the path parameter. Use the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the account to use
Step 2. Retrieve the NSS keys

metadata.title: Get cloud provider accounts
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve a list of the cloud provider accounts that have been added to BlueXP. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.

metadata.title: Get SaaS marketplace account
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the current marketplace account and subscriptions. The subscription identifies how the various cloud services used by the account are charged. Each cloud account can have exactly zero or one subscription.

metadata.title: Get supported services
metadata.purpose: This workflow describes how to use the REST API to retrieve the two ID values. You can also use the BlueXP web UI to get these values. The API returns information about the supported services.

metadata.title: Get tenants
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve a list of tenants visible to the user currently signed in through the account workspace. You can also get the account identifier through the BlueXP web UI.
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the account identifier
Step 2. Get the account workspace

metadata.title: Attach SaaS subscription
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to attach a BlueXP SaaS subscription to a cloud provider account. You will use this value as the _provider_ path parameter in the curl example.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the cloud provider path parameter
Step 2. Determine the account identifier path parameter
Step 3. Get the SaaS marketplace account
Step 4. Attach the subscription

metadata.title: Get active task
metadata.purpose: All requests made to the BlueXP REST API are processed asynchronously except those using the HTTP GET method. Each of the requests is assigned a unique identifier which is returned to the caller in the response. You can use the request ID to retrieve information about the background task.
key_tasks: Step 1. Get the request identifier
Step 2. Get the task

metadata.title: Get the SnapMirror policies
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the SnapMirror policies based on the source and destination Cloud Volume ONTAP instances.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment to use
Step 2. Get the SnapMirror policies

metadata.title: Get the SnapMirror SVM policies
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the SnapMirror policies (owned by cluster admin SVM) based on the source and destination Cloud Volume ONTAP instances.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment to use
Step 2. Get the SnapMirror policies

metadata.title: Create a SnapMirror replication relationship
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new SnapMirror replication relationship to an ONTAP working environment. You can replicate data between working environments by choosing a one-time data replication for data transfer or a recurring schedule for disaster recovery or long-term retention.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the LIFs
Step 3. Select the SnapMirror policy
Step 4. Select the SnapMirror schedule
Step 5. Select the volume names and related storage parameters
Step 6. Create a quote
Step 7. Create the relationship

metadata.title: Delete a SnapMirror replication relationship
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to delete an existing SnapMirror replication relationship. You can issue the REST API call to delete the relationship.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment and related values
Step 2. Delete the relationship

metadata.title: Get the intercluster LIFs
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the intercluster LIFs used in a cluster peering relationship. The workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider you are using.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the intercluster LIFs

metadata.title: Get the status of the replication relationships
metadata.purpose: This workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider you are using. Optionally select the tenant ID. Get the status of the replication relationships.
key_tasks: Step 1. Optionally select the tenant ID
Step 2. Get the status of the relationships

metadata.title: Get status of the replication relationships for a working environment
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the status of all the SnapMirror replication relationships for a specific working environment. This workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider you are using.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the status of the relationships

metadata.title: Get the SnapMirror relationships
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve all the SnapMirror relationship pairs. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint. HTTP method: GET/occm/api/replication/all-relationships. HTTP endpoint: http://api.bluexp.netapp.com/OCcm

metadata.title: Get the replication schedules
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the replication schedules used for a specific working environment. This workflow varies slightly depending on the cloud provider you are using.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the schedules

metadata.title: Update a SnapMirror replication relationship
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to update an existing SnapMirror replication relationship. Select the working environment and related values. All values are for the destination. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment and related values
Step 2. Update the relationship

metadata.title: Before you begin
metadata.purpose: The Cloud Volumes ONTAP REST API provides access to a subset of the functionality available in BlueXP. There are several workflows you can use with public cloud providers. The workflows are organized into the following functional categories.
key_tasks: Workflow categories
Connector setup

metadata.title: Create a working environment with BYOL
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using bring your own license (BYOL) licensing. A marketplace subscription is not required. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with capacity-based license
metadata.purpose: You can create a new Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using capacity-based licensing. You can choose to create a volume using either link:wf_gcp_ontap_create_vol_nfs.html[NFS] or link: wf_
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a working environment with PAYGO
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a new Google Cloud Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using a pay-as-you-go (PAYGO) subscription. A marketplace subscription is required. You can add more volumes after creating the working environment.
key_tasks: Create working environment for single node
Create working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete a working environment
metadata.purpose: You can delete an existing Google Cloud Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. You can delete a single node working environment as well.
key_tasks: Delete working environment for single node
Delete working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get working environment
metadata.purpose: You can use this tool to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP system related details for a single node working environment. You can also use it to retrieve details for other workflows.
key_tasks: Get working environment for single node
Get working environment for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create bucket
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a bucket for a single node working environment. This is a Google Cloud storage bucket (data container in Google Cloud) required for data tiering and backup. Choose the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: Single Node, High availability pair,
key_tasks: Create bucket for single node
Create bucket for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get buckets
metadata.purpose: The S3 buckets are the Google Cloud storage buckets (data containers in Google Cloud) required for data tiering and backups.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get buckets for single node
Get buckets for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Google Cloud disk types
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the Google Cloud supported disk types. You can use this workflow to retrieve Google Cloud disk types for a single node.
key_tasks: Get Google Cloud disk types for single node
Get Google Cloud disk types for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Google Cloud encryption keys
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the Google Cloud encryption keys for a specific region. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get Google Cloud encryption keys for single node
Get Google Cloud encryption keys for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get instance types not supporting acceleration and capacity tiering
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the Google Cloud instance types which do not support the acceleration and capacity tiering. This means that these kind instance types do not use any sort of hardware accelerator. You can check the instance types  while provisioning the Cloud Volumes ONTAP.
key_tasks: Get instance types for single node
Get instance types for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get network requirements
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the minimum number of required IPs for a Cloud Volumes ONTAP system.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volume deployment.
key_tasks: Get network requirements for single node
Get network requirements for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Google Cloud packages
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve Google Cloud packages in a single node working environment. Choose the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: Single Node, High availability pair, Get Google Cloud pair.
key_tasks: Get Google Cloud packages for single node
Get Google Cloud packages for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Google Cloud permutations
metadata.purpose: You can use the permutations endpoint to retrieve the Cloud Volumes ONTAP configuration information. You can check the possible permutations that can potentially be provided for the Google Cloud workflows.
key_tasks: Get Google Cloud permutations for single node
Get Google Cloud permutations for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get projects
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the list of projects that the caller has permission on.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get projects for single node
Get projects for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get Google Cloud regions
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves the Google Cloud regions in which a Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment might be created.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment. You can use this workflow to retrieve the regions in a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Get regions for single node
Get regions for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get service accounts
metadata.purpose: This workflow retrieves a list of service accounts from the specified project. You can use this workflow to retrieve the service accounts in a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Get service accounts for single node
Get service accounts for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get supported features
metadata.purpose: You can perform this workflow to retrieve and check the supported features while provisioning a Cloud Volumes ONTAP instance. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment.
key_tasks: Get supported features for single node
Get supported features for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get supported capacity tiers
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the supported capacity tiers for Google Cloud disk types. You can use this workflow to retrieve the capacity tiers in a single node working environment. Get the supported features using the REST API call.
key_tasks: Get capacity tiers for single node
Get capacity tiers for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get tag keys
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use this workflow to retrieve the tag keys in a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Get tag keys for single node
Get tag keys for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get VPCs
metadata.purpose: You can perform this workflow to retrieve the Google Cloud networks and subnetworks over which a Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment might be created. This workflow is applicable only for an HA working environment.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the project
Step 2. Select the region
Step 3. Get the VPCs

metadata.title: Get zones
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the Google Cloud regions and zones over which a Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment might be created. This workflow is applicable only for an HA working environment.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the project
Step 2. Get the zones

metadata.title: Get Snapshot policies
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment: Get Snapshot policies for single node, Single Node, High availability pair, HA pair. You can use this workflow to retrieve the Snapshot Policies in a single node working environment.
key_tasks: Get Snapshot policies for single node
Get Snapshot policies for high availability pair

metadata.title: Add disks to aggregate
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Add disks to aggregate for single node, Single Node, or High availability pair. Add the disks to the aggregate.
key_tasks: Add disks to aggregate for single node
Add disks to aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create aggregate
metadata.purpose: You can create new aggregates within a Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment using this workflow.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volume deployment: Single Node, High availability pair.
key_tasks: Create aggregate for single node
Create aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create CIFS server configuration
metadata.purpose: If you want to create CIFS volumes on your Cloud Volumes ONTAP system, you first need to configure the CifS server. Review the link:https://.netapp.com/us-en/ontap/smb-config/set-up
key_tasks: Create CIFS for single node
Create CIFS for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create quote
metadata.purpose: You can create a quote for a new volume which returns a resource quote. The resource quote contains aggregate information where the volume will be created and confirms if the space is available.
key_tasks: Create quote for single node
Create quote for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a volume using CIFS
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through CIFS. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Create volume using CIFS for single node
Create volume using CIFS for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a volume using iSCSI
metadata.purpose: There are two workflows available depending on whether a new or existing iGroup is used. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Create volume using iSCSI for single node
Create volume using iSCSI for high availability pair

metadata.title: Create a volume using NFS
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. Create a volume using NFS for a single node working environment. Select the working environment and choose the publicId and svmName.
key_tasks: Create a volume using NFS for single node
Create a volume using NFS for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete aggregate
metadata.purpose: You can delete an existing disk aggregate in a Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment. You can use this workflow to delete an aggregate for a single node.
key_tasks: Delete aggregate for single node
Delete aggregate for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete CIFS server configuration
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a CIFS server configuration for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Delete CIFS for single node
Delete CIFS for high availability pair

metadata.title: Delete volume
metadata.purpose: Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment. You can use this workflow to delete a volume for a  single node working environment.
key_tasks: Delete volume for single node
Delete volume for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get aggregates
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve a list of available disk aggregates for Cloud Volumes ONTAP in Google Cloud.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of deployment.
key_tasks: Get aggregates for single node
Get aggregates for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get CIFS server configurations
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the CIFS server configurations for an existing Cloud Volumes ONTAP working environment.
key_tasks: Get CIFS for single node
Get CIFS for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get iGroups
metadata.purpose: iGroups is a collection of initiators (iSCSI clients) The iGroups information is required when creating a volume with the iSCSI protocol using an existing iGroup.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get iGroups for single node
Get iGroups for high availability pair

metadata.title: Get volumes
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the list of volumes of Google Cloud working environment.Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Get volumes for single node
Get volumes for high availability pair

metadata.title: Modify volume
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to modify the configuration of an existing volume for a single node working environment. Choose the workflow to use based on the type of Cloud Volumes ONTAP deployment.
key_tasks: Modify volume for single node
Modify volume for high availability pair

metadata.title: Before you begin
metadata.purpose: There are several workflows you can use to manage the ONTAP on-premises clusters. You can discover and manage ONT AP clusters with or without a Connector. You need to install and deploy the Connector in your cloud provider or on-Premises environment.
key_tasks: Workflow categories
Connector setup

metadata.title: Discover working environments
metadata.purpose: You can discover the on-premises ONTAP clusters and add them to a working environment using the cluster name as the working environment name. The REST API call uses the following method and endpoint.

metadata.title: Create a FlexGroup volume
metadata.purpose: The ONTAP cluster must be running version 9.7 or later. You should be aware of minimum and maximum size limits. FlexGroup volumes do not support iSCSI block protocol.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the aggregates and constituents
Step 3. Select the network
Step 4. Choose the size for the disk
Step 5. Create the volume

metadata.title: Get working environments
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the on-premises working environment details such as the public identifier, name, and type of the working environment. These details can be used in the input body field while executing other on-Prem workflows.

metadata.title: Create volume using CIFS
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through the CIFS protocol. Choose the working environment and choose the aggregate name.
key_tasks: Step 1. Choose the CIFS configuration
Step 2. Select the working environment
Step 3. Select the aggregate
Step 4. Choose the size for the disk
Step 5. Create the volume

metadata.title: Create volume using iSCSI
metadata.purpose: There are two workflows available depending on whether a new or existing iGroup is used. You need to select the correct workflow to create a volume using iSCSI.
key_tasks: Create volume using iSCSI with a new iGroup
Create volume using iSCSI with an existing iGroup

metadata.title: Create a volume using NFS
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to create a volume accessed through the NFS protocol.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the aggregate
Step 3. Select the network
Step 4. Choose the size for the disk
Step 5. Create the volume

metadata.title: Delete a volume
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to delete a volume. Select the working environment and choose the volume name. You can issue a REST API call to delete the volume.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the volume
Step 3. Delete the volume

metadata.title: Get aggregates
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve a list of available disk aggregates using a REST API call. You can select the working environment to use and choose the publicId for the path parameter. The API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment to use
Step 2. Get a list of aggregates

metadata.title: Get CIFS server configurations
metadata.purpose: You can use this workflow to retrieve the CIFS server configurations for an existing on-premises working environment. Select the working environment and choose the `publicId` value of the working environments. You can issue a REST API call to retrieve these configurations.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the CIFS configurations

metadata.title: Get volumes
metadata.purpose: You can retrieve the list of volumes of an on-premises working environment. You can issue a REST API call to retrieve the volumes. The API call uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Get the volumes

metadata.title: Modify a volume
metadata.purpose: You can modify the configuration of an existing volume. You can issue a REST API call to modify a volume. The example uses the following method and endpoint.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the working environment
Step 2. Select the volume
Step 3. Modify the volume

metadata.title: Workflow processes
metadata.purpose: There are two broad categories of workflows associated with the ONTAP management service. They are as follows: Cloud Volumes ONtAP workflows and ONT AP on-premises workflows.
key_tasks: High level organization of the workflows
Presentation of common tokens and identifiers
Working environment status requirements

metadata.title: Your first API call
metadata.purpose: You can issue a curl command to get started using a Cloud Volumes ONTAP REST API. The following workflow example is very simple. The workflow samples later use a more robust format.
key_tasks: Step 1. Select the identifier
Step 2. Get the access token

metadata.title: Legal notices
metadata.purpose: Legal notices include the common notices for common legal notices. Legal notices include: hardbreaks, hard breaks, nofooter,icons, font, linkattrs, links, images.

metadata.title: Basic concepts and terminology
metadata.purpose: You should be familiar with the basic authentication and authorization concepts before using the BlueXP REST APIs. OAuth 2.0 (OAuth2) is an authorization framework that allows client applications to obtain limited access to the protected resources at an HTTP service. OpenID Connect (OIDC
key_tasks: OAuth 2.0 authorization framework
OpenID Connect protocol
Auth0 platform
Auth0 user
Access tokens
Grant type
Scope
JWT encoding

metadata.title: Additional considerations
metadata.purpose: All resources exposed through the BlueXP APIs are assigned a public ID. Whenever a resource is created or returned, the public ID is displayed in the response. You must specify a resource's public ID when performing operations on the resource.
key_tasks: Public identifiers
Asynchronous processing

metadata.title: Use the API Explorer
metadata.purpose: The API Explorer is integrated with the BlueXP API reference documentation. You can access the API Explorer by clicking *Try it out* on any of the API reference pages.
key_tasks: Before you begin
Issue a REST API call

metadata.title: Basic concepts
metadata.purpose: REST is a style for creating distributed web applications. It establishes a set of technologies and best practices for exposing server-based resources and managing their states. The BlueXP REST APIs use mainstream protocols and standards to provide a flexible foundation for deploying and administering your cloud-based and on-
key_tasks: Overview of the API resources
REST endpoints
Types of input parameters

metadata.title: Connector and client identifiers
metadata.purpose: A Connector is a type of agent deployed in the public cloud on behalf of a customer. It executes commands and other actions as part of managing the local cloud environment. For example, a Connector can be used to access one or more Cloud Volumes ONTAP instances.
key_tasks: Connector
Client ID

metadata.title: Create service token
metadata.purpose: This API call uses the *Auth0* authentication service and not a NetApp BlueXP service endpoint. You need to review the URL in the curl example and adjust for your environment as needed.

metadata.title: Create user token
metadata.purpose: A user token is more commonly used for customer automation than the service token. There are two workflows available to create a user token. The one you select depends on your authentication environment.
key_tasks: Create a user token with federated authentication
Create a user token with nonfederated authentication

metadata.title: Get required identifiers
metadata.purpose: You can access the BlueXP web UI to retrieve the identifiers needed for the workflows. You can also obtain the ID values through the Cloud Volumes ONTAP REST API.
key_tasks: Get the Connector identifier
Get the account identifier

metadata.title: Generate an NSS user ID
metadata.purpose: You can create a NetApp Support Site user ID through the BlueXP web web UI. This ID is included when creating a BlueXP working environment. It enables several features, including subscription to the Cloud Volumes ONTAP system.

metadata.title: Grant types and identity verification
metadata.purpose: There are several OAuth 2.0 grant types available when requesting an access token to use with BlueXP. The grant type is based on the application requirements and authentication environment, and determines how the token is requested.
key_tasks: Refresh token
Password
Client credentials

metadata.title: HTTP details
metadata.purpose: BlueXP REST APIs are based on the HTTP protocol as well as JSON for content exchange. A REST API request contains the standard HTTP methods and request headers. Not all HTTP methods are available at each of the REST endpoints.
key_tasks: Request
Response

metadata.title: Overview of the BlueXP control plane
metadata.purpose: BlueXP enables you to build, protect, and govern your hybrid multi-cloud data. It is composed of several distinct services, each of which exposes an associated REST API. The APIs provide access to a rich set of services including storage, cloud, and security.

metadata.title: Register a service
metadata.purpose: You must have a BlueXP account to register a service. You can use the associated credentials to create a service token. The associated client ID and client secret are displayed.

metadata.title: Use the BlueXP REST APIs
metadata.purpose: There is a general process to prepare and use the authentication and authorization information needed to issue a BlueXP platform REST API call. A BlueXP account is required to access the platform.
key_tasks: BlueXP account
Access token usage scenarios
REST API requirements and your authentication environment
Perform an API call

metadata.title: User access tokens
metadata.purpose: There are two types of access tokens that can be used to establish identity and authorization as part of performing a REST API call. The user access token is generally more common with customer automation applications. The one you select depends on your authentication environment.
key_tasks: Authentication models
Contents of a user token

metadata.title: Workflow processes and tasks
metadata.purpose: The BlueXP REST APIs support many different workflows and tasks. You should be familiar with their common characteristics before reviewing and using a specific API. The workflows provided with this documentation include the minimum steps and parameters needed.
key_tasks: Workflows
Base URLs and REST endpoint paths
Common parameters and variables
Presentation of common tokens and identifiers
Tasks

metadata.title: Additional resources
metadata.purpose: There are additional resources you can access to get help and find more information about NetApp cloud services and support, ONTAP 9, and general REST and cloud concepts.
key_tasks: BlueXP
NetApp cloud resources
REST concepts and cloud technology
